column4: Breakingviews - Singles' Day is shop window for Alibaba's new toys
column5: HONG KONG (Reuters Breakingviews) - Jack Ma is about to show off his new toys. China’s “Singles’ Day”  on Nov. 11  kicks off nearly a month of discounts and promotions. The extravaganza means lots of free PR and huge transaction volumes for Alibaba  his $480 billion behemoth. For investors  the stunts will also illustrate how supermarkets  augmented reality and mobile payments fit in Ma’s "new retail" strategy.

column5: Nov 10 U.S. energy companies added the most oil drilling rigs in week since June as crude prices traded up to their highest levels since the summer of 2015.     Drillers added nine oil rigs in the week to Nov. 10  bringing the total count up to 738  General Electric Co's        Baker Hughes energy services firm said in its closely followed report on Friday.          The rig count  an early indicator of future output  is still much higher than a year ago when
